history.title: The Space Age
history.introduction: In the late 1950s, humanity's fascination with the cosmos ignited a remarkable era of exploration known as the Space Age.

events.title: Sputnik 1 (1957)
events.caption: Sputnik 1 Launch
events.description: The launch of the first artificial satellite, Sputnik 1, in 1957 by the Soviet Union, ushered in a fierce competition with the United States. This rivalry, fueled by the Cold War, pushed both nations to achieve extraordinary feats.

events.title: Yuri Gagarin's Flight (1961)
events.caption: Yuri Gagarin in Vostok 1
events.description: Just four years later, in 1961, Yuri Gagarin, a Soviet cosmonaut, became the first human to break free from Earth's gravity, circling the planet in his Vostok 1 spacecraft. This groundbreaking achievement marked a significant milestone in space exploration.

events.title: Apollo 11 Mission (1969)
events.caption: Neil Armstrong on the Moon
events.description: The United States responded with unwavering determination, culminating in the Apollo 11 mission in 1969. On July 20th, Neil Armstrong, an American astronaut, took 'one giant leap for mankind' as he became the first person to walk on the Moon, forever etching his footprint on lunar soil. These groundbreaking achievements, born out of both ambition and competition, marked the beginning of a continuous journey of discovery, propelling humanity further into the vast unknown.
